Pre-Game Insights: The Rockies have a 2-1 record over the three games they were a moneyline favorite in their last 10 matchups.
The Marlins have a record of 3-7 as underdogs over the last 10 matchups.
The Rockies and their opponents combined to go over the total four times (all 10 games had set totals) in their last 10 outings.
The Marlins and their opponents have combined to hit the over five times in their last 10 games with a total.
Post-Match Reflections: Bill McCartney, a three-time coach of the year in the Big Eight Conference who led Colorado to its only football national championship in 1990, has died.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies are a 1.5-run favorite (at +141 odds) and have -138 moneyline odds to win against the underdog Marlins, who are listed at +117.
The over/under is 11 runs for this game.
Others: Brenton Doyle leads the Rockies in home runs (21) and runs batted in (63).
Ezequiel Tovar has shown his power as he paces his team with 21 home runs with a team-best.274 batting average.
Burger leads the Marlins in home runs (25), runs batted in (59) and has a team-best batting average of.248.
